intro: Rubus buchtienii, commonly known as the Buchtienii blackberry, is a species of shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure member of the Rubus genus.
